title: Front Fork Oil Seal - Inspection

body.body: Use the table below to evaluate the condition of the front fork seals.
Clean off oil residue, refer to
Thin oil film containing dirt or dust
Clean off oil and dust residue, clean the fork seals, refer to the Service Manual and return to customer.
A film of oil including a droplet running down the inner tube

body.name: Ohlins Oil residue - Front Forks - Generic_clbp

body.body: Thin oil film containing dirt or dust
A film of oil including a droplet running down the inner tube
Do not use household cleaning products, bleach, detergents containing any kind of solvent to clean the forks.
Do not spray water directly into the adjuster knobs, electrical components or connectors.
Using aggressive cleaning agents or detergents will cause premature wear and or damage to the motorcycle.
Using a method that will not scratch or damage the polished surfaces, clean the external parts with a proprietary cleaning agent and a soft lint free cloth.
Make sure that all dirt or debris is removed.
Wipe off and dry with a clean cloth.
Inspect the inner tube for corrosion and/or pitting.
Carry out a road test and check for fluid leaks, refer to the table above.

Cleaning
Do not use household cleaning products, bleach, detergents containing any kind of solvent to clean the forks.
Do not spray water directly into the adjuster knobs, electrical components or connectors.
Using aggressive cleaning agents or detergents will cause premature wear and or damage to the motorcycle.
Using a method that will not scratch or damage the polished surfaces, clean the external parts with a proprietary cleaning agent and a soft lint free cloth.
Make sure that all dirt or debris is removed.
Wipe off and dry with a clean cloth.
Inspect the inner tube for corrosion and/or pitting.
Carry out a road test and check for fluid leaks, refer to the table above.
